job_title: Residential Monitor in New Britain, CT
pros: The company is very understanding when it comes to personal time off
cons: Sometimes you will have to work a second shift due to being mandated

review_title: Good cause but underpaid and overworked
job_title: Recovery Specialist in New Britain, CT
pros: Feels great to make a difference and see changes in people's lives, a ton of PTO
cons: Very stressful, benefits aren't great so taking care of your own mental health isn't affordable. Even though there's a lot of PTO, it's hard to actually use it for vacations and planned time off since random last minute days are needed to manage burn out.

job_title: Family Support Specialist in New Britain, CT
pros: The culture of CMHA aligns with my own values
cons: Pay should be much higher for the job responsibilities; our flexibility to work from home flexibility was taken away

job_title: Behavioral Health Specialist in New Britain, CT
pros: 4 weeks sick/PTO days, possibility of growth
cons: Stressful, hard to feel appreciated

job_title: Recovery Specialist in New Britain, CT
pros: I absolutely hated the management and staff. They will work you to death but fault you if something doesnt go as planbed
cons: Is everything an option? Completely toxic work environment

job_title: Residential Monitor in New Britain, CT
pros: The company and its staff is one of of the best in the field.
cons: Staffing is very short in each program and the staff who are working are overworked.

job_title: Recovery Specialist in New Britain, CT
pros: Over all I had a great experience working with client's. The employees were welcoming and helpful. The work space and building located downtown NB is really nice.
cons: Some managers or supervisors micromanage staff. The extent of work requirement does not equal the pay. Also the expectation of supervisors for staff is very unreasonable.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Britain, CT
pros: Very rewarding work helping the clientele and great for experience
cons: Over worked, underpaid. Upper management can’t make decisions in regards to policies and procedures and do not appreciate lower level employees. Time for a new CEO

review_title: Good Foot in the Door Job
job_title: Residential Monitor in New Britain, CT
pros: Plenty of experience with mental health
cons: Very understaffed, underpaid, home office ignores residential.

review_title: Worst place to work ever. They do not know the meaning of mental health.
job_title: Recovery Specialist in New Britain, CT
pros: There are no pros besides accrued PTO
cons: This place will overwork you and mistreat you until you have poor mental health.

job_title: Facilities Coordinator in New Britain, CT
pros: Great agency to work for-great team!
cons: No cons at this time

review_title: Some really great people to work with and a great effort by some of the management to improve things.
job_title: Recovery Specialist in New Britain, CT
pros: Generally good flexibility with scheduling on a department basis. Some great people to work with. Supportive mid level management staff. Decent effort to keep communication between the top management and lower levels of the company continuous.
cons: HR tends to rule with an iron fist with little flexibility or interest in unusual circumstances or situations. Cost cutting at the government level has resulted in the same for the company, but these changes were not equitable. Very little about senior level salaries has changed, while the health benefits were harshly reduced and the retirement plan was switched to a new company with significantly diminished options.

review_title: The worst program I've ever worked at
job_title: Recovery Specialist in New Britain, CT
pros: Good opportunities to gain experience in the mental health field so you can get a job at a better company.
cons: Poor communication and leadership from management. Management ignored our sidestepped valid concerns raised in regards to client and staff safety. Consistently understaffed and overworked. Completing paperwork is more important than the clients.

review_title: Agency has potential, but consider this..
job_title: Recovery Specialist in New Britain, CT
pros: Very efficient & professional trainings, easily navigated computer programs & great PTO offer (you accrue 2 days/16 hrs per month)
cons: Lack of important diversity trainings. Supervisors seem to care more about advocating for clients than advocating or caring about staff. High turnover rate because staff burn out easily & managers don't take precautions for employee self-care or to motivate staff to stay.

job_title: Program Manager in New Britain, CT
pros: Mission of helping people, good opportunities to grow professionally, great people to work with
cons: Time off requests can, at times, not be approved due to constraints with scheduling/program needs.  This can create stress due to inability of taking needed vacations.   Also, benefits are continually shrinking/increasingly expensive, but that is most likely due to current national trends.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Britain, CT
pros: There are some really good, dedicated and hard working people that work here. But, they are hardly ever recognized for it.
cons: Poor communication from management which is supposed to work both ways. Poor leadership. Accountability should be applied across the board including managers, directors and program officers, not just to certain groups of people (lower level staff).

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Wallingford, CT
pros: It is a good place to work.
cons: I wish they would of kept me longer and let me learn more since the way I was taught at a different doctor office was different.

review_title: Great experience out of college but poor work environment
job_title: Recovery Specialist in New Britain, CT
pros: Experience, population you serve, independence with schedule
cons: Pay, poor management, high stress and expectations

job_title: Recovery Specialist in New Britain, CT

job_title: Social Worker in New Britain, CT
